com.google.gwt.gears.client.geolocation
Class PositionOptions

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      com.google.gwt.gears.client.geolocation.PositionOptions

public final class PositionOptions
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject

Encapsulates some optional arguments to make a new Geolocation service call.

setGearsAddressLanguage

public PositionOptions setGearsAddressLanguage(java.lang.String addressLanguage)
Optional, specifies the language in which the address (if requested) should be returned. Specify the language in accordance with RFC 3066, en-GB for British English for example. If this is not specified, the address is provided in the default language of the location provider used to perform the reverse geocoding.

Parameters:
addressLanguage - the language in which the address (if requested) should be returned
Returns:
this instance

setGearsLocationProviderUrls

public PositionOptions setGearsLocationProviderUrls(com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayString urls)
Optional, specifies one or more URLs to contact to convert geolocation signals into positions. Note that these must be complete URLs which include the scheme, e.g. http://gears.mylocationprovider.com. If unset, defaults to a single Google-implemented service. The array can also be cleared, or set to null, so that no location providers are used.

Parameters:
urls - one or more URLs to contact to convert geolocation signals into positions
Returns:
this instance

setGearsLocationProviderUrls

public PositionOptions setGearsLocationProviderUrls(java.lang.String[] urls)
Optional, specifies one or more URLs to contact to convert geolocation signals into positions. Note that these must be complete URLs which include the scheme, e.g. http://gears.mylocationprovider.com. If unset, defaults to a single Google-implemented service. The array can also be cleared, or set to null, so that no location providers are used.

Parameters:
urls - one or more URLs to contact to convert geolocation signals into positions
Returns:
this instance

setGearsRequestAddress

public PositionOptions setGearsRequestAddress(boolean requestAddress)
Optional, requests reverse geocoded address information as part of the position data. Reverse geocoding is not performed if this flag is not specified or if it is set to false.

Parameters:
requestAddress - If true, requests reverse geocoded address information as part of the position data
Returns:
this instance

setHighAccuracy

public PositionOptions setHighAccuracy(boolean enabled)
Optional, requests the most accurate possible results. This may result in slower response times or increased battery consumption. Also, there is no guarantee that the device will be able to provide more accurate results than if this flag is not specified. The default value is false.

Parameters:
enabled - If true, request the most accurate possible results
Returns:
this instance
